Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 13, 2004 be adopted and printed by Council Member McMahon.
Items.ActionText: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 13, 2004 be adopted and printed by Council Member McMahon.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 207-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make nurses available to public and private primary and intermediate schools.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health due back on 11/24/2004.
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. 207-A, Make available a nurse to all public /private primary and intermediate schools on a full-time basis

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Pamela S. Brier, M.P.H. to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her reappointment as a member of the Board of Health, pursuant to Sections 31 and 553 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections due back on 11/24/2004.
Items.MatterName: Pamela S. Brier, M.P.H., Board of Health

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 040501 PCM, 040502 PCM, site selections shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 040499 ZMM that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 040503 PQM, 040504 PQM, 040505 PQM site acquisitions shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 040499 ZMM that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 040506 PPM, a disposition shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 040499 ZMM that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 040507 MMM, 040508 MMM, changes to the city map shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 040499 ZMM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter and Section 62-722(a) of the Zoning Resolution, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 040216 ZSK and no. C 040217, special permits, shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 040215 ZMK that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Fire and Criminal
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to discharge planning services.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Preparing inmates for re-integration into society and providing inmates with assistance in applying for state-issued identification and government benefits.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Department of Health to abide by federal law requiring that incarcerated individuals are returned to Medicaid rolls immediately upon release, by suspending, rather than terminating, the Medicaid benefits of people incarcerated in city jails.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 3 Council Members voted against this item:
 Council Members Gallagher, Lanza, and Oddo.

The following Council Member abstained to vote on this matter: Vallone Jr.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 3 Council Members voted against this item: Council Members Gallagher, Lanza and Oddo.

The folowing Council Member abstained to vote on this matter: Vallone Jr.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: NYS Department of Health and NYC Department of Social Services to abide by federal law requiring that incarcerated individuals are returned to Medicaid rolls immediately upon release.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to ensure that people with convictions are not automatically barred from a wide range of jobs for which they may be qualified and for which they would not endanger the public.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member voted against this item: Council Member Gentile.

The following Council Member abstained to vote on this matter: Vallone Jr.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member voted against this item: Council Member Gentile.

The following Council Member abstained to vote on this matter: Vallone Jr.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to ensure that people with convictions are not automatically barred from a wide range of jobs for which they may be qualified and for which they would not endanger the public.

Items.Title: Resolution honoring the special skills of the medical staff at The Children’s Hospital at Montefiore who performed surgeries for Carl and Clarence Aguirre, honoring the bravery of these two young children and their mother, Arlene Aguirre, and expressing the enthusiasm of this City and the world in their successful recovery for a bright future.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Honor the special skills of the medical staff at The Children’s Hospital at Montefiore.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to allow municipal legislative bodies to adopt more stringent legislation in relation to training, background checks and licensing/registration for private security personnel to address the deficiency of current security measures.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Adopt more stringent legislation in relation to training, background checks and licensing/registration for private security personnel.

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number C 040495 ZSM, a special permit, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number no. C 040496 ZMM and N 040497 that are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.
